message: I created a thread on this in the general Tech forum: https://convore.com/tech/ios-home-screen-obsession/, but I wonder if the Apple people are more into it. How intense are you about your homescreen and app organization on your iOS devices? I'd love to see screenshots and hear your strategies. They just let me into the beta of Homescreen.me, so you can check out mine here: http://homescreen.me/JonMwords
@JonMwords love them I know exactly where things are instead of scrolling a thousand pages
Love copying peoples Homescreens lot of Fun
For me a combo of folders and most used icons works http://desmond.yfrog.com/Himg611/scaled.php?tn=0&server=611&filename=3rzom.jpg&xsize=640&ysize=640
@craigshipp crikey... don't those badges bug you?

Me too. Right now, I'm trying to deal with notifications, because I got Tweetbot, which means I had to get Boxcar. Now I'm loving Boxcar, but I don't know how to deal with badges, because I want them to be where they're supposed to be, not all on Boxcar.

As an aside, I really wish Boxcar could go straight to the message in the app, instead of just opening it to the first place it goes.
They would bug me so much
